content.protection:
Unknown; same chains as

Ninja Crack

.
content.location:
It is between

Ninja Ladder

and

Ninja Crack

.

content.description: Shelter In Place is a nice addition to the crag. Climb a hard boulder problem past the second bolt to a break. It is a good idea to stickclip the second bolt. Bust right on gently overhanging rock to the redpoint crux. Finish moving left at the last bolt.
content.location: It is the furthest right route at the crag.

content.description: Start on a blunt rounded arete next to an intersecting wall on the right.  Climb up right of a block/flake 20 feet up using both sides of the arete. Easy, good beginner lead.
content.protection: 5 bolts, two-bolt anchor in an alcove at a good stance.  Can top out up a short chimney.
content.location: Up a steep gully on the west side of Salt Block Rock.

content.description: Left of the prominent trad crack is a bolted route that runs up to chain anchors. The start is sharp and a bit runout to the first clip (traverse right). This is followed by beautiful and strenuous climbing that fires up an offset, right-facing corner for 25 feet. This is followed by another 25 or so feet of face climbing on largely very good stone. The offset corner felt very powerful, and very finger intensive. This route reminded me of climbing at Security Risk in Boulder Canyon: hard, a bit runout but certainly not dangerous, and on excellent granite. This is great find for whomever put it up and one of the best single pitches in the BTC.
content.protection: 8-10 draws, something for the anchor, and a rope.
content.location: Hike 2 minutes up from the parking. The routes are easily seen from the parking.

content.description: Climb a crack in the black streak.
content.location:
It is right of

Ninja Ladder

in the black streak.

content.description: This 3-bolt line ascends up to then over a prow. The bolts are kind of spaced for a route of this difficulty, with a runout to the anchors. One can preplace a small cam with a long sling between the 3rd bolt and the top to shrink the runout. Rock is a little funky in spots but mostly solid. The route is short and sustained, with some of the harder moves between the 2nd and 3rd bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts + anchors, maybe a small cam.
content.location: On the prow to the left of Ninja Ladder.

climbs.name: How to Kill a Bear with Your Hands

content.description:
Pitch one: Start 10 feet right of

Face Race

on the other side of a block. Start up the steep wall moving up and right past two bolts to easier climbing. Continue up and right to an awkward slot with two bolts (5.8+).  After the slot move back left past one more bolt to a ledge with a 2-bolt anchor.

Pitch two: Finish with the face up and left past two bolts (5.8) to a 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: Right side of the wall between a big block and an outcropping.

content.description:
Start 10 feet left of

Pilgrim

, just left of a big block.  Climb up and right past a horn of rock to a horizontal crack 20 feet up that will take a cam. Continue up the near-vertical wall past 2 bolts to a stance. Finish up the slab past 2 more bolts with the same top out as

Pilgrim

.  You can clip the last bolt of

Pilgrim

.
content.protection:
One cam 1/2 to 3/4 inches, 4 bolts.  Two-bolt anchor in an alcove that is the same as

Pilgrim

.
content.location: Up a steep trail on the left center of the face.
